column8: C1. Begging is caused by poverty and discrimination of minority groups in certain EU countries.
column9: C2. Beggars are victims of poverty in their home countries.
column10: C3. If we begin to help those who come here to beg for it will soon be even more.
column11: C4. Allowing street begging in some EU countries, including Sweden, does not facilitate Romania's efforts to achieve social inclusion and enhancing employability
column13: C6. EU migrants coming to Uppsala due to rumors of more support and shelter for the homeless.
column14: C7. Tourism in Sweden is damaged when the image of a clean and safe country no longer proves correct.
column15: C8. It is not OK to break Swedish law just because the offenders are poor.
column16: C9. I feel guilty that I have it good when I see a beggar.
column17: C10. Beggars should not bring their children to Sweden but leave them at home so they can attend school.
column18: C11. The municipality is responsible for helping the begging EU citizens in Sweden.
column19: C12. Beggars have the same values as us and therefore we have an obligation to help them with school, work, housing and food.
column20: C13. I have no responsibility for helping the begging Roma in Sweden.
column21: C14. We should try the beggars to find other ways to help themselves.
column22: C15. We need to focus on giving them help in their homeland.
column23: C16. Sweden can not take responsibility for all the poor people in the world.
column24: C17. Street scene in Uppsala has changed for the worse since the beggars have come.
column25: C18. The EU is responsible to handle the situation involving EU citizens crossing borders to beg.
column26: C19. Begging EU Citizens really want to go back to their country and not live in Sweden.
column27: C20. Before we assist foreign beggars, we must take care of our own Swedish homeless.
column28: C21. The EU is powerless against Romania's shameless treatment of the Roma minority.
column29: C22. It is our establishment which invites them to beg and take part of our social safety net.
column30: C23. It's good to give money to the beggars
column31: C24. Begging on the streets of Uppsala is organized with connections to the criminal mafia.
column32: C25. There are too many beggars on the streets of Uppsala.
column33: C26. Our tax money should go to the Swedes not to foreign beggars.
column34: C27. They should look for jobs instead of begging.
column35: C28. We can not help so much that we are sending the wrong signals.
column36: C29. The Swedish state is responsible for helping the begging Roma in Sweden.
column37: C30. We must improve the beggars conditions when they are in Sweden.
column38: C31. There is no ultimate responsibility for begging EU citizens.
column39: C32.  Romania is failing to take responsibility for the Roma population.
column40: C33. The emergence of "parallel societies" and "slums" in Uppsala, is not acceptable.
column41: C34. Home countries Romania and Bulgaria have a responsibility to improve the situation of their minority population.
column42: C35. The beggars have it good here in Sweden and would rather live here.
column43: C36. The beggars trying to cheat me out of money by playing sick and poor even though they are not.
column44: C37. Beggars can get away with things that you and I would not get away with.
column45: C38. We should take in more refugees in Sweden.
column46: C39. Politicians in Uppsala take no responsibility for the beggars.
column47: C40. I feel helpless when I see a beggar.
column48: C41. The migrant beggars are eating way the Swedish welfare state
column49: C42. Why don't we just treat the beggars the same as we do refugees? They are in the same situation.
